Generate a Dataset with One Categorical Independent Variable and One Continuous Dependent Variable

Source: R/DatasetOne.R
DatasetOne.Rd

This function simulates a dataset with multiple groups (levels of one IV), each with a specified mean and a shared standard deviation. The dependent variable is continuous, and the standard deviation is constant across groups, emulating homoscedasticity. The number of observations per group is equal, creating a balanced design.

Usage

DatasetOne(n_sample, means, sds)

Arguments

n_sample

Number of observations per group.

means

A numeric vector of group means.

sds

A single numeric value representing the shared standard deviation.

Value

A data.frame with columns iv (group identifier) and dv (dependent variable).

Examples

set.seed(2025)
DatasetOne(n_sample = 30, means = c(120, 135, 115), sds = 20)
